wpt.name: GC8B58
wpt.desc: Uwchlan Trail by surfcap, Traditional Cache (2.5/1.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Uwchlan Trail
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: The cache is located near the Uwchlan Trail near the intersection with the Struble Trail. One place to park is in the lot at the corner of Dowlin Forge and Shelmire Roads. Uwchlan is Welsh for 'upper land' and is pronounced you-clen (with the emphasis on the first syllable).
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
The cache is an ammo box that contains a variety of trinkets.

Make sure to leave time to visit the partially restored mill (near the Uwchlan Trail) and forge (near the Struble Trail), both of which are within 1/2 mile of the cache.

White tail deer populations are managed on Chester County Real Estate consistent with current seasons, bag limits and objectives by the Pennsylvania Game Commission. Hunting on County Real Estate is an effort to scientifically manage wildlife populations within the park system, while preserving a balanced ecosystem while providing ongoing viewing opportunities for the general public. All Department authorized hunters will have a Park-issued hunting permit displayed. It is highly recommended that Geocachers wear orange during all Pennsylvania Game Commission hunting seasons, especially deer seasons. PA Game Commission Orange Rules may be found at http://www.pgc.state.pa.us/pgc/lib/pgc/digestpdfs/2004/orange_rules.pdf.

2004-2005 Deer Seasons: DEER, ARCHERY (Antlered & Antlerless) Statewide: Oct. 2-Nov. 13 & Dec. 27-Jan. 15, 2005. DEER (Antlered & Antlerless) Statewide: Nov. 29-Dec. 11. DEER, ANTLERLESS (WMUs 2B & 5C): Dec. 27-Jan. 15, 2005. More information about hunting may be found at the Pennsylvania Game Commission web site: http://www.pgc.state.pa.us. Specific hunting information may be found in the 2004 - 2005 Hunting Digest

For more information about hunting in the Chester County Park System, please visit: http://www.chesco.org/ccparks.



This cache was placed with the permission of Chester County Parks & Recreation Department. All caches must have the permission of Chester County Parks and Recreation Department. Please follow all Chester County Parks and Recreation Rule and Regulations. Parks are open year-round, 8 am to sunset. Dogs are permitted on a 6' leash. Hunting may take place within the parks during applicable hunting seasons. For more information on Chester County Parks and contact information, please visit http://www.chesco.org/ccparks.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:encoded_hints: Near the base of a root stock.
